question: When you don’t know the answer to something, what is the first thing that you do?
If you could design your dream job, what would it look like?
Can you tell me about a side project you've worked on (outside of school or work) in the past year or so?
Tell me about your process of getting work done. When you get a new job or take on a new project, how do you go about doing it successfully?
How did you first learn to program and what was the first thing you built?
Can you tell us about a time you failed?
Tell me how the Internet works.
What reasons do you have for leaving your current (or most recent) job?
Where do you see yourself in five years?
Tell me about some of the more interesting or difficult problems you've been working on the past few years.
If I were to ask your last set of coworkers to describe you, what do you think they'd say?
Have you made an account on our website and what do you think can be improved about the process?
How do you see yourself contributing to this team in this position?
Why are you taking the time to talk to me (recruiter, employer, etc.) today?
What are your salary requirements / expectations?
Detail the most successful idea you have you taken from concept to launch?
Tell me about a great [product, service, etc.] you've encountered recently. Why do you like it?
What’s the one thing we haven’t asked you about that you want to make sure we know?
